Allow me to explain how to test Large files or Iso.

Greetings! I have been using TPB and thought I must start giving back to the community. 

Always use Virus Total for the very best in Virus Detection.https://www.virustotal.com Use Rar to create archives 30mb in size.

I use RAR to make small archives because https://www.virustotal.com has a 32mb Limit per upload.

Then I go to https://www.virustotal.com/ and upload each archive to be tested.

Very time consuming BUT YOUR 99 Percent sure your Virus FREE. Never Sure100 Percent!

Avoid. Both June and July versions buggy - tried both several times on different computers. The startup is buggy - there are times when the windows load screen hangs several times, making the startup very long. 3rd party programs (especially some specific HP drivers) often load a couple of minutes after the computer has started up. 

BE CAREFUL WITH THUMPERTM VERSIONS!

it gives me an error - file not found
C:/WINDOWS/system32/presetup.cmd - FILE NOT FOUND !
C:/WINDOWS/system32/setupORG.exe - FILE NOT FOUND !
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
POSSIBLE CAUSE:
1. "Presetup.cmd" not excist in the i386 folder on UXPCD
"setupORG.exe" not excist in the i386 folder on UXPCD
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
2.Check your "Txtsetup.sif" in the i386 folder on UXPCD
--- Txtsetup.sif: ---------------------------------------
[SourceDisksFiles]
SetupORG.exe = 1,,,,,2,0,0 ; must exist
presetup.cmd = 1,,,,,2,0,0 ; must exist
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
SETUP ABORT

Upon install, I noticed that this ISO installs a version of the "Generic backdoor" trojan.  It did it for me under hidden files named "mscdsc.exe" and "dll.exe" along with some registry keys to auto-run it. 

Fresh install on clean, new hardware, and this was the only install, no other disks stuck in yet.  I'm guessing this ISO was meant to allow the uploader to take control of piles of home PCs to form a botnet.

Make sure you run a virus scan after install.  AVG trial edition caught and cleaned the problem for me.
